intro: Tirtalia emarginata, commonly known as the margined tirtalia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with a distinctive notched or emarginate base. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typically displaying shades of white and pink. Tirtalia emarginata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
